Some metal powders are reactive and spontaneously form a hard, protective oxide film on contact with oxygen. is oxygen may be in e form of a gas air, for instance, or in some other form, for example water. is ability to rapidly oxidise imparts e need for careful handling, as e potential for fire exists, because e oxidation of e powders gives off heat and, in some cases, explosive gas and is erefore potentially volatile and self-sustaining. Avoid disturbing e powder, particularly in an oxygen rich atmosphere. Risk assess any powders by careful examination of e appropriate Safety Data Sheet. Some metal powders may be harmful to health. is can only be ascertained by consulting e Safety Data Sheet and once again going rough e risk assessment procedure and taking note of e guidance and procedures.
